summary: This is a confidential letter from MoneyGram International, Inc. to the FBI in response to a subpoena dated August 16, 2019. It details MoneyGram's search for transaction records and account information related to specified individuals/entities over a seven-year period and provides a summary of the results, which included some transaction details but no matching online accounts.

persons.name: Erin R. Stotts
persons.context: Author of the letter from MoneyGram International, Inc., responding to the FBI subpoena and providing the requested financial information.

events.title: FBI Subpoena Issued to MoneyGram
events.description: The FBI issued a subpoena to MoneyGram International, Inc. seeking financial transaction records and account information related to specified individuals/entities.

events.title: MoneyGram's Response to Subpoena
events.description: MoneyGram International, Inc. sent a confidential letter to the FBI in response to the subpoena, enclosing a summary spreadsheet of transaction details and certifying the authenticity of the data.

locations: 1550 Utica Avenue S MS: MIN 5508 Minneapolis MN 55416
keyFacts: The FBI subpoenaed MoneyGram for financial records related to specific individuals/entities from August 16, 2012, to August 16, 2019.

MoneyGram produced a summary spreadsheet of transaction details for consumers matching the names, addresses, business name, identification number, and/or telephone numbers listed in the subpoena's Attachment B.
Searches for transactions using the provided business name and identification number yielded no results, and the business entity was not a current or former MoneyGram agent.
A search of the MoneyGram Online database for accounts created with the email address from Attachment B found no matching accounts.
MoneyGram noted that certain documents like Photo ID copies and surveillance video were not in its possession and would need to be requested directly from the agent that conducted the transaction.
